text: (a) If continuous flow equipment is installed for use by flight -crew members, the minimum mass flow of supplemental oxygen required for each crew member may not be less than the flow required to maintain, during inspiration, a mean tracheal oxygen partial pressure of 149 mmHg when breathing 15 litres per minute, BTPS, and with a maximum tidal volume of 700 cm3 with a constant time interval between respirations.
classification_reason: States the mandatory minimum oxygen flow that must be met when continuous-flow equipment is installed, using the verb phrase ‚Äúmay not be less than,‚Äù making it a binding rule.

text: (b) If demand equip ment is installed for use by flight -crew members, the minimum mass flow of supplemental oxygen required for each crew member may not be less than the flow required to maintain, during inspiration, a mean tracheal oxygen partial pressure of 122 mmHg, up to and including a cabin p ressure altitude of 10668 m (35  000 ft), and 95% oxygen between cabin pressure altitudes of 10668 m (35  000) and 12192 m (40  000 ft), when breathing 20 litres per minute BTPS. In addition, there must be means to allow the crew to use  undiluted oxygen at their discretion.
classification_reason: Imposes a required minimum oxygen flow for demand equipment with the obligatory phrase ‚Äúmay not be less than,‚Äù so engineers must comply.

text: (c) For passengers and cabin crew members, the minimum mass flow of supplemental oxygen required for each person at various cabin pressure altitudes may not be less than the flow required to maintain, during inspirati on and while using the oxygen equipment (including masks) provided, the following mean tracheal oxygen partial pressures:
classification_reason: Sets a compulsory oxygen-flow standard for passengers and cabin crew, specifying that flow ‚Äúmay not be less than‚Äù certain values listed in sub-items.

text: (1) At cabin pres sure altitudes above 3048 m (10  000 ft) up to and including 5639 m (18,500  ft), a mean tracheal oxygen partial pressu re of 100 mmHg when breathing 15 litres per minute, BTPS, and with a tidal volume of 700 cm3 with a constant time interval between respirations.
classification_reason: Provides one altitude-specific numeric condition that completes the parent sentence but contains no independent obligation verb of its own.

text: (2) At cabin pres sure altitudes above 5639 m (18  500 ft) up t o and including 12192 m (40,000  ft), a mean tracheal oxygen partial pressure of 83¬∑8 mmHg when breathing 30 litres per minute, BTPS, and with a tidal volume of 1100 cm3 with a constant time interval between respirations.
classification_reason: Supplies another altitude-specific numeric condition that depends on the parent requirement and has no standalone directive.

text: (d) If first -aid oxygen equipment is installed, the minimum mass flow of oxygen  to each user may not be less than 4 litres per minute, STPD. However, there may be a means to decrease this flow to not less than 2 litres per minute, STPD, at any cabin altitude. The quantity of oxygen required is based upon an average flow rate of 3 lit res per minute per person for whom first -aid oxygen is required.
classification_reason: Gives binding limits on first-aid oxygen flow and quantity, using prescriptive wording such as ‚Äúmay not be less than,‚Äù so it is a rule to follow.

text: (e) If portable oxygen equipment is installed for use by crew members, the minimum mass flow of supplemental oxygen is the same as specified in sub -paragraph (a) or (b) of this paragraph, whichever is applicable.
classification_reason: Mandates the minimum oxygen flow for portable equipment by referencing earlier sub-paragraphs, expressing an obligation to meet those limits.

text: When oxygen is supplied to both crew and passengers, the distribution system must be designed for either ‚Äì
classification_reason: Contains the verb 'must' and tells designers how the oxygen distribution system must be arranged when both crew and passengers are supplied.

text: A source of supply for the fl ight crew on duty and a separate source for the passengers and other crew members; or
classification_reason: This item is one option completing the main 'must be designed for either' sentence and has no standalone verb of obligation.

text: A common source of supply with means to separately reserve the minimum supply required by the flight crew on duty.
classification_reason: Like (1), it is the second listed option finishing the parent requirement and lacks its own imperative verb.

text: Portable walk -around oxygen units of the contin uous flow, diluter demand, and straight demand kinds may be used to meet the crew or passenger breathing requirements.
classification_reason: States what kinds of portable oxygen units 'may be used', giving regulatory permission in a self-contained sentence.

text: (See [REF: AMC 25.1447]) If oxygen -dispensing un its are installed, the following apply:
classification_reason: States that the listed rules apply when oxygen-dispensing units are installed, thus defining when the sub-paragraphs become applicable.

text: (a) There must be an individual dispensing unit for each occupant for whom supplemental oxygen is to be supplied. Units must be designed to cover the nose and mouth and must be equipped with a suitable means to reta in the unit in position on the face. Flight crew masks for supplemental oxygen must have provisions for the use of communication equipment.
classification_reason: Uses ‚Äòmust‚Äô to require a unit for each occupant and specifies design obligations engineers must meet.

text: (b) If certification for operation  up to and including 7620 m (25  000 ft) is requested, an oxygen supply terminal an d unit of oxygen dispensing equipment for the immediate use of oxygen by each crew member must be within easy reach of that crew member. For any other occupants the supply terminals and dispensing equipment must be located to allow use of oxygen as require d by the operating rules.
classification_reason: Sets altitude-based obligations, using ‚Äòmust‚Äô to dictate placement of oxygen equipment for crew and other occupants.

text: (c) If certification for operation above 7620 m  (25 000 ft) is requested, there must be oxygen dispensing equipment meeting the following requirements (See [REF: AMC 25.1447(c)] ):
classification_reason: Requires that, above a stated altitude, oxygen equipment meeting later details ‚Äòmust‚Äô be provided, establishing a binding duty.

text: (1) There must be an oxygen -dispensing unit connected to oxygen supply terminals immediately available to each occupant, wherever seated. If certification  for operation above 9144 m (30  000 ft) is requested, the dispensing units providing the required oxygen flow must be automatically presented to the occupants before the cabin press ure altitude exceeds 4572 m (15  000 ft) and the crew must be provided with a manual means to make the dispensing units immediately available in the event of failure of the automatic system. The total number of dispensing units and out lets must exceed the number of seats by at least 10%. The extra units must be as uniformly distributed throughout the cabin as practicable. (See [REF: AMC 25.1447(c)(1)] .)
classification_reason: Mandates both availability and automatic presentation of dispensing units and sets a numeric excess requirement.

text: (2) Each flight -crew member on flight deck duty must be provided with demand equipment. In addition, each flight -crew member must be provided with a quick -donning type of oxygen dispensing unit, connected to an oxygen supply terminal, that is immediately available to him when seated at his station, and this is designed and installed so that it (see [REF: AMC 25.1447(c)(2)] ) ‚Äì
classification_reason: Uses ‚Äòmust be provided‚Äô to obligate demand equipment and quick-donning masks for each flight-deck crewmember.

text: (i) Can be placed on the face from its ready position, properly secured, sealed, and supplying oxygen upon demand, with one hand within 5 seconds and without disturbing eyeglasses or causing delay in proceeding with emergency duties; and
classification_reason: Completes the design requirement by listing a capability the mask must provide; it lacks its own standalone ‚Äòmust‚Äô subject.

text: (ii) Allows, while in place, the performance of normal communication functions.
classification_reason: Further qualifies the parent requirement with an additional performance feature, again without an independent obligation verb.

text: (3) There must be sufficient  outlets and units of dispensing equipment of a type similar to that required by sub -paragraph (c)(1) of this paragraph i n all other  areas that may be occupied by passenger s or crew members during flight.  (See [REF: AMC 25.1447(c)(3)] )
classification_reason: Uses ‚Äòmust be‚Äô to require a sufficient number of outlets and units in other occupied areas.

text: (4) Portable oxygen equipm ent must be immediately available for each cabin crew  member. The portable oxygen equipment must have the oxygen dispensing unit connected to the portable oxygen supply.  (See [REF: AMC 25.1447(c)(4)] .)
classification_reason: Obliges immediate availability of portable oxygen equipment for each cabin crew member, using the word ‚Äòmust‚Äô.

text: There must be a means to allow the crew to determine whether oxygen is being delivered to the dispensing equipment.
classification_reason: It uses the mandatory word "must" to require designers to provide a means for the crew to verify oxygen delivery.

text: (a) For the purpose of this paragrap h, a chemical oxygen generator is defined as a device, which produces oxygen, by chemical reaction.
classification_reason: It explicitly states what a ‚Äòchemical oxygen generator‚Äô means for this rule.

text: (b) Each chemical oxygen generator must be designed and installed in accordance with the following requirements:

text: (1) Surface temperature developed by the ge nerator during operation may not create a hazard to the aeroplane or to its occupants.
classification_reason: States a mandatory outcome‚Äîsurface temperature may not create a hazard.

text: (2) Means must be provided to relieve any internal pressure that may be hazardous.
classification_reason: Requires that means be provided to relieve hazardous pressure, using ‚Äòmust‚Äô.

text: (3)  Comply with [REF: CS 25.795(d)].
classification_reason: Only directs compliance with another rule (CS 25.795(d)) without adding its own obligation.

text: (c) In addition to meeting the requirements in sub -para graph (b) of this paragraph, each portable chemical oxygen generator that is capable of sustained operation by successive replacement of a generator element must be placarded to show ‚Äì
classification_reason: Uses ‚Äòmust be placarded‚Äô to mandate labeling for certain portable generators.

text: (1) The rate of oxygen flow, in litres per minute;
classification_reason: Lists specific placard content without its own verb, completing the requirement in (c).

text: (2) The duration of oxygen flow, in minutes, for the replaceable generator element; and
classification_reason: Another list item that supplies required placard information but lacks an independent verb.

text: (3) A warning that the replaceable generator element may be hot, unless the element construction is such that the surface temper ature cannot exceed 37.8 ¬∞C (100 ¬∞F).
classification_reason: Continues the list of placard contents, qualifying it with a temperature condition, still no standalone verb.

text: (a) Each element of the system , excluding chemical oxygen generators , must have sufficient strength to withstand the maximum working pressures and temperatures in combination with any externally applied load, arising from consideration of limit structural loads that may be acting on that part of the system in service.
classification_reason: States that every system element must withstand specified pressures and loads, imposing a binding obligation.

text: (1) The maximum working pressure must include the maximum normal operating pressure, the transient and surge pressures, tolerances of  any pressure limiting means and possible pressure variations in the normal operating modes. Transient or surge pressures need not be considered except where these exceed the maximum normal operating pressure multiplied by  1¬∑10.
classification_reason: Requires that maximum working pressure include certain pressure conditions, using "must" with its own subject and verb.

text: (2) Account must be taken of the effects of temperature up to the maximum anticipated temperature to which the system may be subjected.
classification_reason: Directs that temperature effects must be considered, containing its own mandate.

text: (3) Strength demonstration using proof pressure and burst pressure coefficients specified in Table 1 is acceptabl e, unless higher stresses result when elements are subjected to combined pressure, temperature and structural loads. TABLE 1 Systems Element  Proof Factor  Burst Factor Cylinders (i.e. pressure vessels)  1¬∑5 2¬∑0 Flexible hoses  2¬∑0 4¬∑0 Pipes and couplings  1¬∑5 3¬∑0 Other components  1¬∑5 2¬∑0
classification_reason: Allows proof and burst pressure testing as an acceptable strength demonstration, constituting a prescriptive requirement.

text: (i) The proof and burst factors in Table 1 must be applied to maximum working pressure obtained from sub -paragraph (a)(1) with consideratio n given to the temperature of sub -paragraph (a)(2).
classification_reason: Mandates application of specific proof and burst factors, using "must" to impose an obligation.

text: (ii) Proof pressure must be held for a minimum of 2 minutes and must not cause any leakage or permanent distortion.
classification_reason: Specifies how long proof pressure must be held and the acceptable results, thus issuing a requirement.

text: (iii) Burst pressure must be held for a minimum of 1 minute and must not cause rupture b ut some distortion is allowed.
classification_reason: Sets holding time and performance criteria for burst pressure, providing a mandatory instruction.

text: (b) Oxygen pressure sources and tubing  lines between the sources and shut -off means must be ‚Äì
classification_reason: Declares that pressure sources and lines must meet listed conditions, creating a binding duty.

text: (1) Protected from unsafe temperatures; and
classification_reason: Completes the verb "must be" from (b) by listing a required attribute without its own verb.

text: (2) Located where the probability and hazard of rupture in a crash landing are minimised.
classification_reason: Continues the list under (b) specifying another required attribute, lacking an independent verb.

text: (c) Parts of the system subjected to high oxygen pressure must be kept to a minimum and must be remote from occupied compartments to the extent practicable. Where such parts are installed within occupied compartments they must be protected from accidental damage.
classification_reason: Requires minimisation and protective placement of high-pressure parts, using mandatory language.

text: (d) Each pressure source (e.g. tanks or cylinders) must  be provided with a protective device  (e.g. rupture disc). Such devices must prevent the pressure from exceeding the maximum working pressure multiplied by 1¬∑5.
classification_reason: Demands protective devices on each pressure source and limits pressure, thus imposing obligations.

text: (e) Pressure limiting devices (e.g. relief valves), provided to protect parts of the system fro m excessive pressure, must prevent the pressures from exceeding the applicable maximum working pressure multiplied by 1¬∑33 in the event of malfunction of the normal pressure controlling means (e.g. pressure reducing valve).
classification_reason: Mandates performance of pressure-limiting devices, stating what they must prevent.

text: (f) The discharge from each prot ective device and pressure limiting device must be vented overboard in such a manner as to preclude blockage by ice or contamination, unless it can be shown that no hazard exists by its discharge within the compartment in which it is installed. In assessin g whether such hazard exists consideration must be given to the quantity and discharge rate of the oxygen released, the volume of the compartment into which it is discharging, the rate of ventilation within the compartment and the fire risk due to the inst allation of any potentially flammable fluid systems within the compartment.
classification_reason: Specifies how protective device discharges must be vented and assessed, presenting mandatory actions.

text: If fluids subject to freezing may be drained overboard in flight or during ground operation, the drains must be designed and located to prevent the formation of hazardous quantities of ice on the aeroplane as a result of the drainage.
classification_reason: The sentence uses 'must' to mandate how drains are designed and located to avoid hazardous ice, imposing a binding design obligation.

text: The recording requirements of sub -paragraph (a)(2) of this paragraph must be met by installing a cockpit -mounted area microphone, located in the best position for recording voice communications or iginating at the first and second pilot stations and voice communications of other crew members on the flight deck when directed to those stations. The microphone must be so located and, if necessary, the pre -amplifiers and filters of the recorder must be so adjusted or supplemented, that the intelligibility of the recorded communications is as high as practicable when recorded under flight cockpit noise conditions and played back. Repeated aural or visual playback of the record may be used in evaluating in telligibility.

text: Each cockpit voice recorder must be installed so that the part of the communication or audio signals specified in subparagraph (a) of this paragraph obtained from the following sources is recorded on at least four separate channels: No channel shall record communication or audio signals from more than one of the following sources: the first pilot station, second pilot station, cockpit -mounted area microphone, or additional crew member stations. As far as is practicable, all the sounds received by the microphones listed in subparagraphs (c)(1), (2) and (4) of this paragraph must be recorded without interruption irrespective of the position of the interphone -transmitter key switch. The design must ensure that sidetone for the flight crew is produced only when the interphone, public address system or radio transm itters are in use.

text: Supplementary take -off performance information applicable to aeroplanes operated on slippery wet runways and on runways  contaminated with standing water, slush, snow , or ice may be furnished at the  discretion of the applicant.  If supplied, this information must include the expected performance of the aeroplane during take -off on hard -surfaced runways covered by these contaminants. If information on any one or more of  the above surface  conditions  is not supplied, the AFM must contain a statement prohibiting  take -off on surfaces that do not meet the minimum friction criteria, or  contaminated surface(s) for which information is not supplied. text: Maximum ambient atmospheric temperature. A maximum ambient atmospheric temperature corresponding to sea level conditions must be established. text: Correction factor. text: (1) Be designed and constructed so that no fire originating in any APU fire zone can enter, either th rough openings or by burning through external skin, any other zone or region where it would create additional hazards,
classification_reason: Completes the parent ‚Äúmust‚Äù sentence without repeating the modal word, detailing how the aircraft must be designed.

text: (2) Meet sub -paragraph (e)(1) of this paragraph with the landing gear retracted (if applicable), and
classification_reason: Continues the parent obligation, adding a specific condition about landing-gear position but no new ‚Äòmust‚Äô.

text: (3) Have APU compartment external skins, in areas subject to flame if a fire starts in an APU fire zone, complying with the following:
classification_reason: Still governed by the parent ‚Äòmust‚Äô, it introduces the requirement for external skins and leads into finer sub-items.

text: (i)  For in -flight operations, APU compartment external skins must be fireproof in the complete concerned areas, and
classification_reason: Contains its own verb phrase ‚Äúmust be fireproof,‚Äù directly mandating skin performance for in-flight operations.

text: (ii)  For ground operations, APU compar tment external skins must be :
classification_reason: Uses ‚Äúmust be‚Äù to impose requirements for ground operations, with details split into further sub-clauses.

text: (a)  Fireproof in the portions of the concerned areas where a skin burn through would affect critical areas of the aeroplane, and
classification_reason: Acts as a bullet under (ii), listing where skins must be fireproof without restating a modal verb.

text: (b)  Fire-resistant or compliant with subparagraph (e)( 1) of this paragraph in the remaining portions of the concerned areas.

text: (See [REF: AMC 25.1193(e)] )
classification_reason: The paragraph identifier is the section heading, which simply frames the topic without giving a specific obligation.

text: Fire extinguishing agents must:
classification_reason: Uses the word ‚Äúmust‚Äù to impose requirements on fire-extinguishing agents.

text: Be capable of extinguishing flames emanating from any burning of fluids or other combustible materials in the area protected by the  fire extinguishing system; and
classification_reason: Lists the first specific condition that completes the ‚Äòmust‚Äô obligation in (a) but carries no independent ‚Äòmust/shall‚Äô.

text: Have thermal stability over the temperature range likely to be experienced in the compartment in which they are stored.
classification_reason: Provides the second specific condition linked to the ‚Äòmust‚Äô in (a); it does not stand alone as a separate obligation.

text: If any toxic extinguishing agent is used, provisions must be made to prevent harmful concentrations of fluid or fluid vapours (from  leakage during normal operation of the aeroplane or as a result of discharging the fire extinguisher on the ground or in flight) from entering any personnel compartment, even though a defect may exist in the extinguishing system.
classification_reason: Contains its own ‚Äúmust‚Äù directive, obliging designers to prevent toxic agent fumes from entering crew or passenger areas.

text: Each extinguishing agent container must have a pressure relief to prevent bursting of the container by excessive internal pressures.
classification_reason: States that every extinguisher container must include pressure relief; it imposes a mandatory design obligation.

text: The discharge end of each discharge line from a pressure reli ef connection must be located so that discharge of the fire extinguishant agent would not damage the aeroplane. The line must be located or protected to prevent clogging caused by ice or other foreign matter.
classification_reason: Requires specific placement and protection of discharge lines, using ‚Äúmust‚Äù to set binding requirements.

text: There must be a means for each fire extingu ishing agent container to indicate that the container has discharged or that the charging pressure is below the established minimum necessary for proper functioning.
classification_reason: Mandates a means to indicate container discharge or low pressure, clearly setting a compulsory rule.

text: The temperature of each container must be maintained, under intended operating condit ions, to prevent the pressure in the container from:
classification_reason: Obliges that container temperature be controlled, containing the verb ‚Äúmust be maintained,‚Äù establishing a requirement.

text: Falling below that necessary to provide an adequate rate of discharge; or
classification_reason: Finishes the main sentence of (d) without its own verb, describing one temperature-related condition to avoid.

text: Rising high enough to cause premature discharge.
classification_reason: Continues the list under (d) without an independent verb, giving the second condition to be prevented.

text: If a pyrotechnic capsule is used to discharge the extinguishing agent, each container must be installed so that temperature conditions will not cause hazardous deterioration of the pyrotechnic capsule.
classification_reason: Sets a binding rule on installing containers when a pyrotechnic capsule is used, indicated by ‚Äúmust be installed.‚Äù

text: (a) No material in any fire extinguishing system may react chemically with any extinguishing agent so as to create a hazard. (b) Each system component in an APU compartment must be fireproof.
classification_reason: This is the section header that simply frames the topic (fire extinguishing systems) and introduces the detailed rules that follow.

text: (a) No material in any fire extinguishing system may react chemically with any extinguishing agent so as to create a hazard.
classification_reason: It prohibits materials that chemically react with the extinguishing agent, imposing a clear mandatory rule.

text: (b) Each system component in an APU compartment must be fireproof.
classification_reason: It mandates that every APU-compartment component be fire-proof, a direct obligation using the word ‚Äúmust.‚Äù

text: There must be approved, quick acting fire or overheat detectors in each APU compartment in numbers and locations ensuring prompt detection of fire.

text: Each fire detector system must be constructed and installed so that:

text: There is a means to warn the crew in the event of a short circuit in the sensor or associated wiring within a designated fire zone , unless the system continues to function as a satisfactory detection system after the short circuit.

text: No fire or overheat detector may be affected by any oil, water, other fluids, or fumes that might be present.

text: There must be means to allow the cre w to check, in flight, the functioning of each fire or overheat detector electric circuit.

text: Wiring and other components of each fire or overheat detector system in a fire zone must be at least fire -resistant.

text: No fire or overheat detector system comp onent for any fire zone may pass through another fire zone, unless:

text: It is protected against the possibility of false warnings resulting from fires in zones through which it passes; or

text: Each zone involved is simultaneously protected by the same det ector and extinguishing system.

text: Each fire detector system must be constructed so that when it is in the configuration for installation it will not exceed the alarm activation time approved for the detectors using the response time criteria specified in ETSO -2C11e or an acceptable equivalent, for the detector.
